01.020000: Contact with their secretions or discharges (from mouth, nose, eyes, milk, urine)
01.040000: Soil (dead bodies or droppings contaminate the soil)
01.050000: Mother goat to kid during pregnancy

02.010000: Check each goat for health every day!
02.020000: Separate the goat if it looks sick or you have a doubt that it is sick.
02.030000: Clean the secretions of sick goats with water and soap
02.040000: Disinfect the soil where the sick goat lived
02.050000: If the goat dies, bury or burn it and disinfect the area
02.060000: A SICK GOAT MUST NOT BE CONSUMED!

03.010000: Keep goats away from water streams or muddy areas where snails are found. Snails can transmit internal parasites.
03.020000: Use grass from water stream borders and from muddy areas to make hay. Dry hay for 1 month and only then, feed the goats with it.
03.030000: Reserve one area of water stream for drinking and keep it free of plants and snails. You can place stones in the area of water stream to avoid mud.

PARAGRAPH.05: You can train adolescents to remove the ticks:

02.030000: Turn the tweezers clockwise, so that the tick comes out completely
02.040000: Collect all ticks in a container
02.050000: Do not let the ticks free again

03.010000: Apply neem oil onto the skin of all those goats. These goats are more sensitive and need the help of neem oil.

04.030000: Because of ticks, kids or adult goats are more weak, and can get infected with worms
